metadata.synopsis: Chef Primo (Tony Shalhoub) and businessman Secondo (Stanley Tucci) are immigrant brothers from Italy who open their dream restaurant, Paradise, in New Jersey. However, Primo's authentic food is too unfamiliar for the local tastes, and the restaurant is struggling. When famous Italian-American bandleader Louis Prima is scheduled to appear at Paradise, the two brothers put all of their efforts into the important meal, which will likely decide the fate of their restaurant.

reviews: It will send your salivary glands into Tex Avery territory, but "Big Night" is layered with the delicacy, care & closely guarded alchemy of a family recipe - evolving beyond food as emotional or communicative currency into something more bittersweet.
Delicious adult fare sure to leave you hungry.
An actor for sophisticated palates, Tucci's too good to stay obscure any longer.
A triumph for everyone involved, but especially for Stanley Tucci.
A lyrical love poem to food and family (or is it family or food?), this serio comedy joins the company of other fun movies about eating, such as Babette's Feast and Like Water for Chocolate.
A feast of great acting and tender, small moments
A wonderful film about how the simple pleasures of life -- food, family, friends -- aren't so simple.
One's appetite will be big for both the food and the movie
Tucci and Shalhoub always deliver and Big Night is just futher evidence of that.
As they always say, less is more.
